snippet: After two decades of European dominance in the Ryder Cup, the Americans have created a task force to figure out why they keep losing.
abstract: Tiger Woods and Phil Mickelson are among 11 players, captains and PGA of America officials appointed to group that will study how American team can win Ryder Cup following two decades of European dominance; other golf news noted.
lead_paragraph: After two decades of European dominance in the Ryder Cup, the Americans have created a task force to figure out why they keep losing.

headline.main: Group to Study U.S.'s Ryder Cup Slump
headline.print_headline: Group to Study U.S.’s Ryder Slump
